bibles.title: The New Testament in Fang
bibles.description: The Fang New Testament was translated by Acacio Mba Micha, a skilled storyteller with a vast knowledge of traditional Fang culture. He is a graduate of the Bibleschool IBCP founded by WEC International in Bata and his translation style prefers a contextual approach rather than a literal one. For instance, the number 9 in Fang culture signifies completion and perfection. So in 1 Samuel 2:5 When Hannah says: “The barren has borne seven.” Acacio, understanding the poetic, symbolic context, said, “The barren woman has become the mother of nine.” With help from Andrew Case, a member of SIL International, who served as the principal translation consultant The translation project would be completed in 2014.

language.name: Fang (Equatorial Guinea)
